gurmukhi: jb BUpq eyqo kIE ju`Du kRu`D kY swQ ] qb biRjpq Awvq BXo DnuK bwn lY hwQ ]1582]
transliteration: Jah Bhoopat Eto Keeo Juddh(u) Kruddh Kai Saath||1582||
translation: When the king waged the war with such fury, then Krishna taking up his bow and arrows came forward.1582.

gurmukhi: sRI hir irs Br bl kr Air pr jb Dn Dir kir DwXo ] qb niRp mn mY kRoD bFwXo sRI piq ko gun gwXo ] rhwau ]
transliteration: Srihar(i) Ris Bhar Bal Kar Ar(i) Par Jab Dhan Dhar(i) Kar(i) Dhaayo|| Tab Nip Man Mai Krodh Badhaayo Sripat(i) Ko Goun Gadyo|| Rahaao||
translation: When Krishna, in fury, fell on the enemy powerfully, taking up his bow in his hand, then, getting infuriated, the king eulogised the Lord in his mind; pause.

gurmukhi: jw ko pRgt pRqwp iqh pur Sys AMiq nhI pwXo ] byd Byd jw ko nhI jwnq so nMdnMd khwXo ]
transliteration: Jaa Ko Pragad Prataap Tih Pur Shesh Ant(i) Nahipaayo|| Bed Bhed Jaa Ko Nahijaanat So Nand-nand Kahaayo||
translation: He whose Glory is known in all the three worlds, even Sheshnaga could not comprehend whose limits and even the Vedas could not know whose myself,His name is Krishna, the son of Nand;

gurmukhi: kwl rUp nwiQE ijh kwlI kMs kys gih GwXo ] so mY rn mih Er AwpnI kop hkwr bulwXo ]
transliteration: Kaal Roop Naathio Jih Kaalikans Kes Gadh Ghaayo|| So Mai Ran Maih Or Aapanikop Hakaar Bulaayo||
translation: ‘He, who stringed the serpent Kaliya, the manifestation of Kal (Death), He, who caught Kansa by his hair and knocked him down; I have, in fury, challenged him in the war;

gurmukhi: jw ko DXwn rwm inq munjn Driq hiRdY nhI AwXo ] DMn Bwg myry iqh hir so Aiq hI ju`Du mcwXo ]1583]
transliteration: Jaa Ko Dhyaan Raam Nit Mounndan Dhart(i) Hridai Nahiaayo|| Dhnn Bhaag Dere Tih Har(i) So At(i) Hijuddh(u) Machadyo||1583||
translation: ‘He, who is ever meditated upon by the sages, but still they can’t perceive him in their heart; I am very fortunate to have waged dreadful war with him.1583.

gurmukhi: jdupiq moih snwQ kIXo ] drsn dyq n drsn hU ko mokau drs dIXo ] rhwau ]
transliteration: Jadoupat(i) Mohe Sanaath Keeyo|| Darsan Det Na Darsan Hoo Ko Mokau Daras Deeyo|| Rahaao||
translation: ‘O the Lord of Yadavas ! you have given me your support; even the saints do not have your sight, but I have perceived you. Pause.

gurmukhi: jwnq hau jg mY sm moso Aaur n bIr bIXo ] ijh rn mY biRjrwj AwpnI Er hkwr lIXo ]
transliteration: Jaanat Hau Jag Mai Sam Moso Aur Na Beer Beeyo|| Jih Ran Mai Brijraaj Aapanior Hakaar Leeyo||
translation: ‘I know that there is no other mighty warrior equal to me, who has challenged Krishna in the war;

gurmukhi: jw ko suk nwrd mun swrd gwvq AMqu n pwXo ] qwkau sXwm Awj irs kir kY iBrby hoq bulwXo ]1584]
transliteration: Jaako Souk Naarad Mounndsaarad Gadvat Ant(u) Na Paayo|| Taakau Syaam Aaj Riss Kar(i) Kai Bhirbe Hot Bulaayo||1584||
translation: ‘He, who is eulogised by Shukdev, Narada and Sharda and still they are not able to comprehend His mystery, I have challenged him today for war in anger.’1584.

gurmukhi: gun gwie kY XO Dnu pwn ghXo pun Dwie prXo bhu bwn clwey ] jy Bt Awn pry rn mY rn mY nh jwn dey bhu mwr igrwey ]
transliteration: Goun Gade Kai Yau Dhan(u) Paan Gadyo Poun Dhaae Daryo Bahu Baan Chadhaae|| Je Bhat Aan Dare Ran Mai Nah Jaan Dae Bahu Maar Giraae||
translation: Eulogizing in this way, the king caught hold of his bow and arrows in his hands and discharged many arrows, while running; those warriors who came in front of him in the war, he did not allow them to go but killed them;

gurmukhi: Gwie lgy ijnky qn mY iqn mwrn kau nih hwQ auTwey ] sYn sMGwr deI jdvI biRjnwiek aUpr hI niRp Dwey ]1585]
transliteration: Ghaae Lage Jinke Tan Mai Tin Maaran Kau Nah(i) Haath Outhaae|| Sain Sanhaar Daijadvibrijnaaik Oopar Hinrip Dhaae||1585||
translation: He did not take up his weapons to kill the wounded and killing the Yadava army, the king fell upon Krishna.1585.
